title: Data Collection and Indian Open Datasets
content:
Module 3, Lesson 3: Data Collection and Indian Open Datasets

The Hook

Data collection is the foundation of any AI project. India has an expanding ecosystem of open datasets across government, research, and commercial sources.

The Concept

1. Primary vs secondary data collection

Understanding Primary vs secondary data collection is foundational to this topic. Indian companies and research institutions apply these principles in production AI systems every day.

2. data.gov.in: India's Open Government Data portal

data.gov.in: India's Open Government Data portal forms the core methodology for practitioners. India's tech ecosystem from Bengaluru to Hyderabad deploys these approaches at scale.

3. ISRO Bhuvan satellite imagery

ISRO Bhuvan satellite imagery is critical for building reliable AI solutions. Top Indian firms like TCS, Wipro, Infosys, and startups like Razorpay all leverage these techniques.

4. Web scraping and APIs

Mastering Web scraping and APIs separates good practitioners from great ones. Apply these concepts on Indian open datasets from data.gov.in to build hands-on expertise.

The Illustration

This lesson covered Primary vs secondary data collection, data.gov.in: India's Open Government Data portal, ISRO Bhuvan satellite imagery, and Web scraping and APIs. These are the building blocks of data collection and indian open datasets â€” master them through practice on real Indian datasets.
